subjective.chief_complaint: Dry, itchy, sore, and cracked skin on chest and back for 4 days
subjective.hpi: Patient presents with a 4-day history of dry, itchy, sore, and cracked skin affecting the chest and back. Reports no bleeding, discharge, or spread of the rash. Patient is aware of the condition but identifies no specific triggers. Tried OTC steroid cream last night with minimal effect. Has also tried antihistamines. Patient is systemically well with no fevers, vomiting, shortness of breath, cough, or bowel symptoms. Patient suspects this is related to their eczema.
subjective.patient_history: Eczema, Asthma. No Known Drug Allergies (NKDA). No regular medications.

plan.patient_instructions: Review in 10-14 days if no better, or earlier if there are concerns or worsening.

metadata.ocr_quality_check: Generally good legibility with specific formatting. Date is illegible. 'Cetrabem' corrected to 'Cetraben' based on context.
critical_ambiguities: Specific dosage strengths for medications not listed
